quotes.quote: Lips like rosebuds peeping out of snow.
Language is wine upon the lips.
The lips of those we love are sweet to us in life, and sacred in death.
Lips, like roses dropping myrrh.
Everything you declare with your lips will be tested in your life.
Lips are the most sensual organ we are allowed to expose.
Lips with such sweetness in their honeyed deeps. As fills the rose in which a fairy sleeps.
Your lips are my persuasion, your love will be my cure.
Lips, however rosy, must be fed.
My lips are big, but my talent is bigger.
Lips moulded in love are tremulously full of the glowing softness they borrow from the heart, and electrically obedient to its impulses.
For attractive lips, speak words of kindness.
Her lips were like living fire. He could not take his own away. He forgot everything.
Oh how sweet it is to hear one's own convictions from another's lips.
Lips, like hanging fruit, whose hue. Is ruby 'neath a bloom of blue.
Soul meets soul on lovers' lips.
Lips are no part of the head, only made for a double-leaf door for the mouth.
The time comes upon every public man when it is best for him to keep his lips closed.
You know how you're supposed to choose between playing up your eyes or your lips? I always choose lips. I love the drama.
Pure lips, sweet seals in my soft lips imprinted. What bargains may I make still to be sealing?
When the lips are opened, we behold the image of the soul.
Lips are the fingerprints of love.
My lips are like camera for her, whenever I click her with my lips, she smiles.
